revised_title: Nuclear Specific Heat in Paramagnetic Cupric Salts
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the specific heat of paramagnetic cupric salts and found that a part of the specific heat is independent of the degree of dilution. They identified this part as the nuclear specific heat due to nuclear-electronic interaction within the atom. The results are in agreement with observations of the hyperfine structure in dilute copper salts made from paramagnetic resonance experiments.
